intro: Cleisocentron malipoense, commonly known as the Malipo starling tree, is a species of flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically consumed by various bird species. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
